name: Simulated Annealing
description: Probabilistic technique that emulates the cooling of metals to escape local minima and find near-optimal solutions
when_to_use: Discrete optimization with many local minima
When you need to escape local optima probabilistically
Problems like TSP, graph partitioning, or scheduling
When solution quality matters more than computation time
when_not_to_use: When tight time bounds are required (slow convergence)

complexity.time: O(iterations * neighbor_generation_cost), highly dependent on cooling schedule
complexity.space: O(solution_dimension) for current and best solutions

embedding_text: Simulated annealing is a stochastic optimization technique inspired by metallurgical annealing. Accepts worse solutions with probability exp(-Î”E/T) where T decreases over time. High temperature allows exploration, low temperature favors exploitation. Effective for combinatorial optimization and escaping local minima through controlled randomness.
